org.jetel.hadoop.mapreduce

Class HadoopJobResult

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.hadoop.mapreduce.HadoopJobResult

  • public final class HadoopJobResult
extends java.lang.Object
    A bean class intended to store various information and results of execution of map/reduce job sent to (and executed on) Hadoop cluster. All the job statistics and results are initialized in constructor and available through getters. This class is immutable.
    Since:
    rel-3-4-0-M2
    See Also:
    HadoopJobRunner.runJobLogProgress(HadoopMapReduceService, HadoopMapReduceJob, Properties, boolean)

    • Constructor Detail

      • HadoopJobResult

        public HadoopJobResult(HadoopJobReporter reporter,
               java.lang.String jobName,
               java.lang.String jobId,
               long startTime,
               long stopTime,
               boolean timeouted,
               java.lang.Exception error,
               boolean jobSuccessfull,
               boolean jobComplete,
               java.lang.String lastPhase,
               float lastPhaseProgress)
        Creates new HadoopJobResult instance that stores information about run of map/reduce job. The null value is accepted value for all non primitive parameters of this constructor.
        Parameters:
        reporter - Utility allowing to obtain job information from Hadoop cluster or null if there was exception while starting the job.
        jobName - A name of the job that was given to it by a user. Non unique identification of the job.
        jobId - Unique identification of the job assigned by cluster.
        startTime - Start time of the job in milliseconds since start of year 1970 (Unix or POSIX time). If measured correctly it should be greater or equal to current time.
        stopTime - End time of the job in milliseconds since start of year 1970 (Unix or POSIX time). If measured correctly it should be greater or equal to current time. Must be equal or greater then start time.
        timeouted - true if and only if the job has stopped due to its duration was longer then set timeout.
        error - Exception that occurred during job execution and caused the job to be prematurely terminated.
        jobSuccessfull - true if and only if the job finished successfully.
        jobComplete - false if and only if the job was still running when this constructor was called.
        lastPhase - Last phase of the job that was in progress when the job was stopped. If the job was successful this must be last phase in job life.
        lastPhaseProgress - Progress of last phase of the job. Must be in interval <0, 1> inclusive. Must be equal to 1 if the job was successful.
        See Also:
        HadoopJobRunner.runJobLogProgress(HadoopMapReduceService, HadoopMapReduceJob, Properties, boolean)

    • Method Detail

      • getReporter

        public HadoopJobReporter getReporter()
        Gets reporter for the job.
        Returns:
        Utility allowing to obtain job information from Hadoop cluster or null if there was exception while starting the job.

      • getJobName

        public java.lang.String getJobName()
        Gets name of the job.
        Returns:
        A name of the job that was given to it by a user. It is non unique identification of the job. Might be null.

      • getJobId

        public java.lang.String getJobId()
        Gets job identificator.
        Returns:
        Unique identification of the job assigned by cluster. Can be null if job did not start successfully.

      • getStartTime

        public long getStartTime()
        Gets job start time.
        Returns:
        Start time of the job in milliseconds since start of year 1970 (Unix or POSIX time).

      • getStopTime

        public long getStopTime()
        Gets end time of the job.
        Returns:
        the stopTime End time of the job in milliseconds since start of year 1970 (Unix or POSIX time).

      • isTimeouted

        public boolean isTimeouted()
        Indicates whether the job has stopped due timeout.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the job has stopped due to its duration was longer then set timeout.

      • getError

        public java.lang.Exception getError()
        Gets Exception that caused the job to stop.
        Returns:
        Exception that occurred during job execution and caused the job to be prematurely terminated.

      • isJobSuccessfull

        public boolean isJobSuccessfull()
        Indicates whether the job is successful.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the job finished successfully.

      • isJobComplete

        public boolean isJobComplete()
        Indicates whether the job is complete.
        Returns:
        false if and only if the job was still running when this instance of HadoopJobResult was created.

      • getLastPhase

        public java.lang.String getLastPhase()
        Gets last phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Last phase of the job that was in progress when the job was stopped. If the job was successful always returns last phase in job life (see isJobSuccessfull()).

      • getLastPhaseProgress

        public float getLastPhaseProgress()
        Gets progress of the last phase of the job.
        Returns:
        Progress of last phase of the job which is a value from interval <0, 1> inclusive. It is always equal to 1 if the job was successful (see isJobSuccessfull()).
